abstract: The European plane maker cited expectations of increasing wealth in Asia and growth in low-cost airlines in the United States and Europe.
snippet: The European plane maker cited expectations of increasing wealth in Asia and growth in low-cost airlines in the United States and Europe.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — The European plane maker Airbus raised its long-range forecast for commercial aircraft demand Monday, citing expectations of increasing wealth in fast-growing Asia and the continued expansion of low-cost airlines in the United States and Europe.

headline.main: Airbus Raises Its Forecast for Demand
headline.print_headline: Airbus Raises Its Forecast For Jet Sales
